page.title: 11Miss Patterson
page.content: Miss Patterson came to live in Kirkpatrick Durham in 1964. When she came to Kirkpatrick Durham there were about 70 people in the village. In 1964 there were good bus services. The entertainment then included whist drives, fiddlers concerts, coffee evenings and a lot more. At that time there were a lot of jobs. There was no unemployment. There weren't many children, more adults than children. The fashions were mini-skirts and little hats. There were quite a lot of cars then. The farms were about the same number as in 1985. The prices have really gone up a lot. There wasn't much money then, but much more now. Houses then weren't modern and they didn't have modern gadgets.
